intro: Linum pamphylicum subsp. papilliferum, commonly known as the papillate flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Linaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. This subspecies is distinguished by the presence of papillae on its leaves, giving it its common name.
